ML_Engine.models package¶

Models Sub-package¶

Modules for model configuration, training, and AutoML.

Submodules¶

ML_Engine.models.automl module¶

AutoML Module¶

Functions for AutoML integration with PyCaret and H2O.

ML_Engine.models.automl.get_available_automl_backends() → list[source]¶

Get list of available AutoML backends.

ML_Engine.models.automl.get_pycaret_feature_importance(train_df: DataFrame, target_column: str, problem_type: str = 'classification', **pycaret_kwargs) → DataFrame[source]¶

Get feature importance from PyCaret’s setup.

Parameters:

  • train_df (pd.DataFrame) – Training data.

  • target_column (str) – Name of the target column.

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'}) – Type of problem.

  • **pycaret_kwargs – Additional keyword arguments passed to PyCaret’s setup function.

Returns:

A DataFrame with feature importances.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

ML_Engine.models.automl.run_h2o_automl(X_train: ndarray, y_train: ndarray, problem_type: str = 'classification', max_runtime_secs: int = 60, max_models: int = 10, **h2o_kwargs) → Tuple[Any, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Run H2O AutoML.

Parameters:

  • X_train (np.ndarray) – Feature matrix

  • y_train (np.ndarray) – Target vector

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'}) – Type of problem

  • max_runtime_secs (int) – Maximum runtime in seconds

  • max_models (int) – Maximum number of models to train

  • **h2o_kwargs (additional keyword arguments) – Passed to H2O AutoML

Returns:

  • best_model (best model from H2O AutoML)

  • h2o_results (dict with H2O results)

ML_Engine.models.automl.run_pycaret_automl(train_df: DataFrame, target_column: str, problem_type: str = 'classification', sort_by: str | None = None, enable_optimization: bool = False, **pycaret_kwargs) → Tuple[Any, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Run PyCaret AutoML.

Parameters:

  • train_df (pd.DataFrame) – Training data

  • target_column (str) – Name of target column

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'}) – Type of problem

  • sort_by (str, optional) – Metric to sort models by (default: ‘Accuracy’ for classification, ‘R2’ for regression)

  • remove_outliers (bool) – Whether to remove outliers in PyCaret setup

  • enable_optimization (bool) – Whether to tune the best model

  • **pycaret_kwargs (additional keyword arguments) – Passed to PyCaret setup

Returns:

  • best_model (best model from PyCaret)

  • pycaret_results (dict with PyCaret results)

ML_Engine.models.configs module¶

Model Configurations¶

Loads and manages model configurations from external YAML files.

ML_Engine.models.configs.get_model_config(model_name: str, problem_type: str, config_path: str = None) → dict[source]¶

Get configuration for a specific model.

Parameters:

  • model_name (str) – Name of the model.

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'}) – Type of problem (case-insensitive).

  • config_path (str, optional) – Path to a custom model configuration YAML file.

Returns:

Model configuration.

Return type:

dict

ML_Engine.models.configs.list_models(problem_type: str, config_path: str = None) → list[source]¶

List available models for a problem type.

Parameters:

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'})

  • config_path (str, optional) – Path to a custom model configuration YAML file.

Returns:

List of model names.

Return type:

list

ML_Engine.models.training module¶

Model Training and Hyperparameter Tuning¶

Functions for training ML models, hyperparameter tuning, and model management. Supports traditional ML, PyCaret AutoML, and H2O AutoML (optional).

class ML_Engine.models.training.CategoricalModelWrapper(base_model, categorical_mappings, categorical_columns)[source]¶

Bases: object

Wrapper for models trained with categorical encoding. Applies the same categorical encoding during prediction.

get_params(deep=True)[source]¶

Get parameters for this estimator.

predict(X, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predict with encoding.

predict_proba(X, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predict probabilities with encoding.

score(X, y, **kwargs)[source]¶

Score with encoding.

set_params(**params)[source]¶

Set parameters for this estimator.

class ML_Engine.models.training.ModelTrainer(problem_type: str, model_class: Any, model_config: Dict[str, Any], model_params: Dict[str, Any], class_weight=None, tuning_config: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, tuning_metric: str | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Trainer for ML models with support for hyperparameter tuning and multi-output.

Train model with basic settings (no hyperparameter tuning).

Returns:

  • model (trained model)

  • history (dict with training information)

Returns:

  • best_model (best model from search)

  • search_results (dict with search results)

Returns:

Get list of available hyperparameter tuning methods.

ML_Engine.models.training.load_model(filepath: str) → Tuple[Any, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Load trained model from file.

Returns:

  • model (loaded model)

  • metadata (model metadata)

ML_Engine.models.training.run_experiment(experiment_name: str, X_train: ndarray, y_train: ndarray, X_test: ndarray, y_test: ndarray, config_path: str = None, **kwargs) → DataFrame[source]¶

Run a pre-defined experiment from a YAML configuration file.

Parameters:

  • experiment_name (str) – The name of the experiment to run (must be a key in the YAML file).

  • X_train (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • y_train (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • X_test (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • y_test (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • config_path (str, optional) – Path to the experiments YAML file. Defaults to configs/experiments.yml.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments passed to the train_model function (e.g., cv, sample_weight).

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the performance metrics for each model in the experiment.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

ML_Engine.models.training.run_model_comparison_experiment(X, y, problem_type, models_to_compare=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Alias for train_and_compare_models for backward compatibility.

Parameters:

  • X (array-like) – Feature data

  • y (array-like) – Target data

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'}) – Problem type

  • models_to_compare (list of str, optional) – Models to compare

  • **kwargs (dict) – Additional arguments passed to train_and_compare_models

Returns:

Dictionary with model comparison results (different format than train_and_compare_models)

Return type:

dict

ML_Engine.models.training.save_model(model: Any, filepath: str, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, save_format: str = 'pickle') → str[source]¶

Save trained model to file.

Parameters:

  • model (trained model)

  • filepath (str) – Path to save model

  • metadata (dict, optional) – Additional metadata to save

  • save_format ({'pickle', 'joblib'}) – Format to save model

Returns:

str

Return type:

path where model was saved

ML_Engine.models.training.train_and_compare_models(X_train: ndarray, y_train: ndarray, X_test: ndarray, y_test: ndarray, problem_type: str, models_to_compare: List[str] | None = None, sort_by: str | None = None, **kwargs) → DataFrame[source]¶

Train and compare multiple scikit-learn models.

Parameters:

  • X_train (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • y_train (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • X_test (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • y_test (array-like) – Training and testing data.

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'}) – The type of machine learning problem.

  • models_to_compare (list of str, optional) – A list of model names to compare. If None, all models for the problem type will be used.

  • sort_by (str, optional) – The metric to sort the results by. Defaults to ‘Accuracy’ for classification and ‘R2’ for regression.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments passed to the train_model function.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the performance metrics for each model, sorted by the specified metric.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

ML_Engine.models.training.train_model(model_name: str, X_train: ndarray, y_train: ndarray, problem_type: str = 'classification', model_params: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, tuning_method: str | None = None, tuning_config: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, tuning_metric: str | None = None, n_trials: int = 100, cv: int = 5, sample_weight: ndarray | None = None, class_weight=None, **kwargs) → Tuple[Any, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

High-level function to train a model with optional hyperparameter tuning.

Parameters:

  • model_name (str) – Name of model (must be in model_configs)

  • X_train (array-like) – Training data

  • y_train (array-like) – Training data

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'})

  • model_params (dict, optional) – Model-specific parameters

  • tuning_method ({None, 'randomized_search', 'grid_search', 'optuna'}) – Hyperparameter tuning method

  • tuning_config (dict, optional) – Tuning configuration

  • tuning_metric (str, optional) – Metric to optimize

  • n_trials (int) – Number of trials for tuning

  • cv (int) – Cross-validation folds

  • sample_weight (array-like, optional) – Sample weights

  • class_weight (dict or 'balanced', optional) – Class weights for classification

  • **kwargs (dict) – Additional arguments passed to the training method.

Returns:

  • model (trained model)

  • training_info (dict with training details)

ML_Engine.models.training.tune_hyperparameters(model_name: str, X_train: ndarray, y_train: ndarray, problem_type: str = 'classification', n_trials: int = 100, cv: int = 5, random_state: int = 42, **kwargs) → Tuple[Dict[str, Any], Any][source]¶

High-level function for hyperparameter tuning using Optuna.

Parameters:

  • model_name (str) – Name of model (must be in model_configs)

  • X_train (array-like) – Training data

  • y_train (array-like) – Training data

  • problem_type ({'classification', 'regression'})

  • n_trials (int) – Number of Optuna trials

  • cv (int) – Cross-validation folds

  • random_state (int) – Random seed for Optuna sampler

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments passed to train_model

Returns:

  • best_params (dict) – Best hyperparameters found

  • study (optuna.study.Study) – Optuna study object (or None if Optuna not available)
